data.title: Our people
data.text:
Amanda Dubarry

Chief Executive

amanda.dubarry@your-place.org.uk

Amanda joined as Chief Executive in 2018, bringing 22 years’ experience at a youth homelessness charity where she supported its growth from its grass roots beginning to operating across five counties.

Amanda has since developed Your Place's strategic plan, mission and values, and spearheaded the expansion of our service provision, with focuses on additional accommodation, rough sleeping, gender- and psychologically-informed approaches.

She is an experienced trustee, having served on the Board of several national, regional and local charities across the homelessness, health and housing sectors – including One Newham and Give, which is a current Board member of.

Amanda is passionate about making a difference and developing excellent services to achieve meaningful outcomes for service users, and her work has been award-winning in this respect.

John Lowery

Director of Frontline Services

john.lowery@your-place.org.uk

John joined as Director of Frontline Services in 2018. He has significant sector experience, having worked in day centres, charities and housing associations across London and the South East, delivering high quality housing support and social care services.

John’s interest in criminal justice is reflected by his experience working for a crime reduction charity and having previously been a member of the Essex Probation Board. John is a mentor as part of Housing Diversity Network’s Mentoring Programme.

Lucy Inkster (Maternity Leave)

Director of People

lucy.inkster@your-place.org.uk

Lucy joined us in 2023. She has a background in charities, and has held roles at Diabetes UK, the Young Foundation, and the Arthritis Society of Canada. Most recently, she worked as Head of People & Volunteering at the Felix Project, where she helped lead the London-wide charity’s rapid expansion during the pandemic.

Lucy was previously a Trustee for an education charity in Toronto, and holds law degrees from the University of Cambridge and UCL.

Siva Selliah

Director of Finance

siva.selliah@your-place.org.uk

Siva joined our team in 2018. Having worked in finance for over 20 years, and in several housing associations along the way, Siva has comprehensive experience and passion for his work.

Siva's previous role was with a primary care organisation caring for patients across London, where he acted as Finance Controller, and he has also worked for small charities providing housing and support for people experiencing homelessness and mental health problems.

Simon Hall MBE

Chair of Trustees

Simon was educated at Ampleforth College and St. Catharine’s College, Cambridge. He qualified as a solicitor in 1979, and was Partner with Freshfields Bruckhaus Deringer 1985-2014. He was head of Freshfields Finance Practice, sat on the Partnership Council and was head of their global corporate responsibility programmes.

Simon was and is a trustee of several charities, focused mainly on education and social inclusion, including St Mary's School, Career Academies UK, Mistley Maltings Trust, Brentwood Cathedral Choral Trust, Colchester and North East Essex Building Preservation Trust, and the fundraising board of Ampleforth College. Simon was awarded an MBE in 2006.

Charles Abel Smith

Charles has extensive international experience developing innovative funding and managing infrastructure-related investment across the public and private sectors. He has held and holds a number of directorships with organisations including ARUP, BNP Parabis and Kleinwort Benson. Charles has worked with the UK Government to develop investment opportunities within the energy efficiency markets, and is now Director of Energy Efficiency with the UK Green Investment Bank.

Charles was a Non-Executive Director of the North Essex Partnership NHS Trust for seven years, with particular focus on the development of the trust’s estate. He has an MA from Cambridge University.

Laura Curtis

Laura is a Fellow of the Institute of Actuaries with experience in a variety of actuarial roles within the insurance sector, focusing on enterprise risk management and financial assessments. She has also volunteered within her profession for a number of years in multiple positions.

Laura is passionate about social, health and environmental issues and using her professional experience for community benefit.

Emer Delaney

Emer qualified as a solicitor in 2010 and worked as a corporate M&A lawyer at the US law firm, White & Case LLP, in the city of London. Since 2017, Emer has been in-house legal counsel at Close Brothers Group plc, a FTSE 250 bank, and advises across a broad range of legal matters.

She has a BA in Politics and Philosophy from University College Dublin and an MSc in Comparative Politics from the London School of Economics.

Cate Kirkbride

Cate is an experienced brand and marketing leader in the charity and corporate sectors. She is passionate about storytelling and putting supporters at the heart of charity communications to inspire loyalty and action. Cate is Director of Communications and Engagement at the International Society of Ultrasound in Obstetrics and Gynecology, and has recently held similar roles at the NCT Charity, Marie Curie UK and Shelter.

Homelessness is a cause very close to Cate’s heart, and she is delighted to be able to support the charity’s development in her role as Trustee.

Kevin Maxwell MBE

Kevin joined Your Place as a Next Generation Trustee completing the Board Trainee Programme with the Housing Diversity Network. He’s a member of the Belonging and People Committees.

Outside of Your Place, Kevin writes and advocates for social justice and equality. He’s passionate about Belonging and was awarded an MBE for services to diversity through literature for his book about prejudice and resilience, and works for a homelessness charity leading on Equity, Diversity and Inclusion (ED&I).

Kevin is a Member of the Chartered Institute of Housing and a Fellow of the Royal Society of Arts. He likes to run.

Graeme McLean

Graeme has wide-ranging financial services experience together with leadership skills. He is currently the Head of Transformation at the Financial Conduct Authority, and on joining our Board, has taken on the role of Chair of our Financial, Risk and Governance Committee.

Through his professional life and volunteering, he has appreciation for the challenge faced by the most vulnerable people in our community. He is hugely motivated to assist Your Place in its efforts to address homelessness in Newham, where the need is so great.

Rose Soffel

Rose is an experienced People & Culture leader, specialising in organisational development and building high-performing teams. Spending over 10 years in the financial services and technology sectors, she has developed a keen expertise in fostering team growth, building inclusive cultures, and driving employee engagement. Now in a not-for-profit organisation, Rose applies her skills towards supporting the business goals in driving impactful societal change. Rose is honoured to contribute her skills to the charity, homelessness is a cause close to her heart.
